loc_100.name: Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum Hội An
loc_100.description:
Located right in the ancient town of Hội An, the Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum is a unique stop for those who love history and wish to explore the roots of Vietnamese culture. The Sa Huỳnh Museum is a landmark in Quảng Ngãi, and the Sa Huỳnh culture is the common name for the entire cultural heritage in Central Vietnam. This culture spans from Quảng Bình to Ninh Thuận, Bình Thuận and dates back from the 2nd century BC to the 2nd century AD, approximately 2000 years of history. Archaeological discoveries in Hội An such as: Hậu Xá I, Hậu Xá II, An Bàng, Cẩm Phô, Trảng Sỏi, Lăng Bà, Thanh Chiếm, Bãi Ông – Cù Lao Chàm… have shown that the Sa Huỳnh residents once lived, fished, farmed, and engaged in vibrant trade with neighboring regions as well as many cultures outside the area. From these archaeological sites, hundreds of artifacts have been found, revealing a vivid picture of a community with a high level of spiritual, aesthetic, and social organization. To preserve and showcase this valuable collection, the Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum was established in 1994 and has become one of the first specialized museums on archaeology in Central Vietnam. 

The Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum impresses with its two-story architecture that bears a strong French influence, both elegant and harmoniously blended into the ancient urban space. It currently houses and displays over 1,000 original artifacts, vividly reflecting the material and spiritual life of the Sa Huỳnh residents. The displayed artifacts are diverse, including everyday items such as pots, dishes, and teapots; as well as agricultural tools associated with ancient farming, fishing, and trading such as hoes, sickles, and knives. Notably, the museum also preserves coins from the Ngũ Thù and Vương Mãn periods of the Han Dynasty (China), demonstrating the early economic and cultural exchanges between the Sa Huỳnh residents and neighboring areas. Additionally, the collection of jewelry from the Sa Huỳnh residents showcases refined aesthetic standards and skilled craftsmanship, made from stone, agate, and various precious minerals. The most prominent pieces include three-pronged earrings, hoop earrings, and unique beaded jewelry. Sa Huỳnh ceramics are an important highlight of the museum, featuring a variety of forms from pots, bowls, and plates to teapots decorated with intricate embossed and engraved patterns, reflecting the rich aesthetic taste and spiritual life of the ancient residents. Particularly, the jar tombs – a distinctive burial form of the Sa Huỳnh people – are displayed here in various shapes: oval, egg-shaped, cylindrical, with or without lids. Through this, viewers can observe clear signs of social stratification at that time – indicative of the formation of social classes and primitive management institutions. All the artifacts displayed at the Sa Huỳnh Cultural Museum are not only compelling evidence of a brilliant historical period but also contribute to clarifying the ancient civilization in Hội An in particular and Central Vietnam in general – a place where cultural, artistic, and intellectual values of our ancestors have converged and crystallized for thousands of years.

**Essential Information**  
Address: 149 Trần Phú, Hội An Ward, Da Nang City  
Opening hours: 07:00 – 21:00 (closed on the 10th of each month)

loc_101.name: Da Nang City Memorial and March 29 Square
loc_101.description: The Da Nang City Memorial is a place that honors the heroes and martyrs who fell in the great war of the nation. This site is often a stop for tourists visiting Da Nang on their journey to explore the culture and history of this land. A PLACE TO REMEMBER THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THOSE WHO CAME BEFORE Our country – A nation that throughout its history has always been associated with the cause of building and defending the country, has witnessed a generation of people willing to sacrifice their personal interests for the common good of the nation. During that prolonged resistance period, those who fell before were succeeded by those who rose up; countless Vietnamese people have laid down their lives on this land. Blood and bones have soaked into every inch of the homeland from North to South. A PLACE FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS TO EXPRESS GRATITUDE TO THOSE WHO CAME BEFORE The peace we enjoy today is the result of the sacrifices made by an entire generation. In keeping with this tradition, in the heroic land of Da Nang – the birthplace of brave and resilient children – 27 cemeteries and memorials have been established, among which the City Memorial for Heroes and Martyrs is one of the most prominent works. The City Memorial for Heroes and Martyrs is familiar to the people of Da Nang by the name 2/9 Monument. When traveling to Da Nang, the city’s memorial for heroes and martyrs, also known as the 2-9 Monument, is an architectural site with historical significance that you should visit. Not only is it beautifully designed and rich in humanity, but bowing to light an incense stick at the memorial is also a way for Vietnamese people to express their gratitude to the previous generation. The architecture of the 2-9 Monument The 2/9 Monument is situated in a beautiful location. Behind it flows the poetic Han River, creating a cool, quiet, and solemn space. In front is a long road named 2/9 – a brilliant milestone of the Vietnamese nation. The area in front of the monument is very spacious and often hosts major events of the city. The 2-9 Monument is a synthesis of ideas from architect Pham Sy Chuc and sculptor Pham Van Hang, along with the late painter and sculptor Do Toan. The monument's main structure consists of three wings forming a tripod that converges and rises high, creating a solid and imposing stance amidst the sky and earth. The creative points in the architecture and design of the monument are not only reflected in the lines of the base and body of the statue but also in the integrated functional structure of the pedestal. Beneath the soaring architecture of the statue, a solemn space is constructed to hold incense burners, wreaths, and to commemorate the heroes and martyrs. In the center, on the conical ceiling, images of soldiers holding guns, sacrificing themselves for the country, are shaped by hundreds of thousands of unique ceramic pieces. The phrase “The Fatherland remembers” is placed vertically in the middle of the monument's body, adding dignity and grandeur to the structure while expressing deep gratitude to the generations of ancestors who bravely sacrificed in wars against foreign invaders, bringing peace and independence to the nation. In August 2024, the Da Nang City People's Committee will hold a ceremony to inaugurate the upgraded and restored City Memorial and to renovate and expand the 29/3 Square. The project to upgrade and restore the city memorial and to renovate and expand the 29-3 Square has a total investment of over 212 billion VND from the city budget and socialization; it was started in 2022 and is divided into two phases. In phase 1, the city memorial will be upgraded, a new relief will be created, and the landscape, foundation, and lighting system will be improved. Phase 2 will involve constructing the technical infrastructure around the memorial and the square, highlighted by an artistic water fountain. This project is a heartfelt tribute from the people, soldiers, and officials of the city to remember the contributions of the heroes and martyrs who sacrificed in the struggle to build and protect the city. loc_102.name: Lune Performing Arts Center Hoi An
loc_102.description: If you are looking for a unique experience of Vietnamese culture, the Lune Performing Arts Center in Hoi An is definitely a destination you cannot miss. HOI AN LUNE CENTER – WHERE ART RESOUNDS BETWEEN TWO RIVERS Located at the confluence of the Hoai River and the Thu Bon River, the Hoi An Lune Center – Lune Performing Arts Center in Hoi An is like an artistic gem amidst the tranquil space of the ancient town of Faifo. The theater features a unique bamboo dome architecture, inspired by the symbol of the full moon – the moon rising, blending into the vast sky and water of the heritage region. The performance space is designed in a spherical shape with a diameter of 24.5m, a peak height of 13m, a floor area of 470m2 with a round stage and 299 seats arranged in a semi-circular layout – set up in a gradually rising tier. Every sunset, when the last rays of sunlight gild the waves and the myriad of enchanting lanterns are lit, the sounds of gongs, T’rưng instruments, flutes, and elephant drums resonate from the auditorium, opening up a spectacular journey to explore and honor traditional values as well as the community spirit of the villages, blending with the wild yet heroic energy of the Central Highlands through the bamboo circus show Teh Dar. Teh Dar means “to go in a circle” in the K’ho language, signifying the preservation of beautiful and diverse ethnic cultural traits, as the artists continuously inspire the circle of life of the tribes, allowing cultures to keep evolving. The performance is an inspiring combination of bamboo circus and bold acrobatics, dancing, and juggling set to live indigenous music, having toured many countries around the world and proudly captivating both Vietnamese and international audiences with its unique storytelling and rich cultural essence. The confluence of rivers adds strength to the continuity of life and natural forms. The Hoi An Lune Center can also be seen as a gathering place, not only celebrating the beauty and talent of people in circus arts but also becoming a bridge to bring Vietnamese culture closer to audiences worldwide. Performance schedule: 18:00 every day of the week, except Monday and Friday. Ticket prices: There are 3 ticket categories aah! [A]700,000 VND ooh! [O]1,150,000 VND wow! [W]1,600,000 VND CONTACT INFORMATION Lune Performing Arts Center Website: www.luneproduction.com Call Center/Zalo: +84 845 18 11 88 Email: reservation@luneproduction.com Address: 1A Nguyen Phuc Chu, Hoi An Ancient Town, Da Nang City. loc_103.name: Hoi An Traditional Art Performance House
loc_103.description: Located by the poetic Thu Bon River, at 66 Bach Dang, Hoi An Ward, Da Nang City, the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center is a distinctive, professional cultural art space rich in identity. AN ART SPACE IN THE HEART OF THE ANCIENT TOWN The traditional art performance center was established in 1996, situated in a two-story ancient house facing the Thu Bon River. The first floor is used to display various types of masks and traditional musical instruments, allowing visitors to explore and participate in mask painting if desired during performances. The second floor of the house is professionally invested to serve the performance programs. The Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center has been established for nearly 30 years, with artistic programs that have brought much aesthetic enjoyment to a large number of domestic and international tourists, significantly contributing to the preservation of traditional cultural and artistic values in the locality. CULTURAL COLORS THROUGH EACH PERFORMANCE With a team of skilled staff, creative musicians, and choreographers, the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center has staged and performed programs rich in regional cultural identity. Notable performances include Ho Hat Bai Choi, Quang Nam folk songs, Central Vietnam folk songs, folk dances, and traditional instrumental ensembles. The highlight of the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center is the performances that strongly reflect the cultural imprint of Hoi An in particular and Central Vietnam in general. Visitors can enjoy Bai Choi singing – a form of folk music combined with fun folk games that express community spirit; listen to folk melodies accompanied by the sound of the monochord, bamboo flute, and heartfelt singing; admire folk dances and traditional instrumental ensembles such as water dance, offering dance, gongs, drums, and ethnic instruments presented vividly, allowing the audience to easily immerse themselves in the artistic space. Additionally, Hat Boi (also known as Hat Tuong) – a unique traditional theater form rich in emotion – also leaves a deep impression on viewers. A MEETING POINT FOR CULTURE AND ART At the performance center, visitors not only enjoy the art but also feel the enduring vitality of Vietnamese culture. With daily performances at times such as 10:15, 15:15, and 16:15, the Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center has evoked many emotions for a large number of domestic and international tourists, helping them gain a deeper understanding of the spiritual life of the local people, and serving as a highlight in the journey to explore the Ancient Town of Hoi An – a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Moreover, visitors here have the opportunity to explore the first-floor exhibition area with masks, traditional musical instruments, participate in Tuong mask painting, experience activities teaching various musical instruments, folk singing, coconut leaf folding, calligraphy, ceramic face painting, making lanterns, and more. The Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center is not only a place to preserve traditional artistic values but also a "bridge" connecting the past and present, between local people and tourists from all directions. Each performance, each note, and each song here tells a story about the soul, love, and cultural identity of Hoi An. IMPORTANT INFORMATION Hoi An Traditional Art Performance Center Address: 66 Bach Dang Street, Hoi An Ward Contact: Hoi An World Heritage Cultural Conservation Center – Address: 10B Tran Hung Dao Street, Hoi An Ward, Da Nang City – Phone: +84-235-3861327 – Email: trungtamvhtthoian@gmail.com – Website: http://www.hoianworldheritage.org.vn DA NANG CITY TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_104.name: Non Nuoc Stone Sculpture Memory Museum - Marble Mountains
loc_104.description: The Non Nuoc Stone Carving Memory Museum - Marble Mountains was established with the mission of preserving an important part of memory and introducing to everyone about the Non Nuoc stone carving village through various stages. Address: R1-R12 Trường Sa, Hoà Hải, Ngũ Hành Sơn, Đà Nẵng. The stone carving profession is located at the foot of the mountain, closely linked to the Marble Mountains like a shadow; therefore, the museum also plays a small role in preserving and developing both tangible and intangible culture at the Marble Mountains scenic area. The Non Nuoc Stone Carving Memory Museum - Marble Mountains officially began operations on 24/04/2023. The museum spans over 2000 m2, located at the foot of Thuy Son mountain, at the corner of Huyen Tran Cong Chua and Trường Sa streets, making it very convenient for tourists visiting the heritage and scenic journey in Central Vietnam such as Hue - Hoi An - My Son - Son Tra - Marble Mountains… The museum features a dual space, with an interior of over 700m2 housing hundreds of artifacts, tools for traditional craftsmanship, and valuable products in many aspects. The exterior offers a spacious and cool environment where visitors can stop for refreshments, enjoying the mountains and sea from the “Trăng Nước Xưa” coffee corner. At the museum, visitors can reminisce and experience vividly the enduring legacy of a unique craft village among the best in Vietnam. Here, visitors can also learn about the tradition of formation and development of the craft village, as well as the recognized contributions. While visiting the museum, guests will gain certain knowledge about various types of stone materials, and can compare ancient and modern crafting methods, whether handmade or using CNC technology, distinguishing between products made from natural stone or artificial stone. Moreover, by visiting the museum, guests contribute to preserving the essence of the past and inspire current and future generations to strive for material wealth without impoverishing the soul, together building a life oriented towards “Truth - Goodness - Beauty.” According to baotangdieukhacnonnuoc.vn

loc_105.name: Áo Dài Show Da Nang
loc_105.description:
The "Áo Dài Show" program is a storytelling experience about the history and traditional culture from ancient times to the present, showcasing the Vietnamese dynasties through various historical periods. It connects the royal court to the folk culture, blending traditional and modern cultures, aiming to provide visitors with a deeper understanding of the formation and development of the Vietnamese nation and its people, as well as the evolution of the traditional Áo Dài, which has existed for nearly 300 years. The Áo Dài has been recognized as the national costume of Vietnam since the Nguyễn Dynasty. The program is presented through images of the Royal Court – Nguyễn Dynasty Palace, 100 years of traditional Vietnamese Áo Dài, traditional weddings, scenes of Vietnamese schoolgirls in white Áo Dài, and the Áo Dài Show. The Vietnamese Traditional Culture program "Áo Dài Show" in Da Nang city will always be a highlight of cultural tourism. The "Áo Dài Show" promises to offer visitors impressive and unforgettable experiences of traditional Vietnamese cultural values. 

THE "ÁO DÀI SHOW" PROGRAM LASTS 60 MINUTES 
SHOWTIME DAILY: 01 PERFORMANCE: 19:45 
TICKET PRICE: 400,000 VND/TICKET 
ADDRESS: NGŨ HÀNH SƠN CULTURAL CENTER, 1A TRẦN VĂN ĐÁN, KHUYÊN MỸ WARD, NGŨ HÀNH SƠN DISTRICT, DA NANG CITY, VIETNAM 
CAPACITY: 400 SEATS 

PROGRAM SECTIONS OF THE "ÁO DÀI SHOW" 
1. Introduction: History of Vietnamese Dynasties 
An introduction to Vietnam through the historical periods of nation-building via images and narration by the MC. 
2. Performance: Royal Court Colors 
"Royal Court Colors" is the opening act of the show, introducing the audience to the splendid beauty of the Royal Court – Nguyễn Dynasty Palace during the last royal festival of Vietnam. The performance aims to convey to visitors a vivid and impressive image of the royal beauty depicted in the costumes of Kings, Queens, and officials of the Nguyễn Dynasty during the feudal era – where the traditional Áo Dài of Vietnam was formed. The act also features traditional court dances. 
- Fan Dance 
- Offering Wine Dance 
- Chầu Văn Singing + Cup Dance 

3. Performance: 300 Years of Traditional Áo Dài – Scene of the Old Market 
The Old Market scene will take visitors on a journey to explore the rustic, gentle, and simple aspects of cultural life through the ages. The Old Áo Dài performance recreates the Old Market of the Vietnamese people in simple yet elegant Áo Dài costumes from the late 18th century to the early 20th century. 

4. Performance: Traditional Vietnamese Wedding 
The Nhật Bình dress and Ngũ Thân Áo Dài are the predecessors of today's Áo Dài, symbolizing the traditional cultural attire of the Vietnamese people. The Áo Dài has always been the formal attire chosen by brides, grooms, and Vietnamese families for happy wedding ceremonies in the past. The "Traditional Wedding" performance vividly depicts an ancient wedding, honoring the customs and cultural beauty of the Vietnamese people. 

5. Performance: Lotus Dance / Lantern Dance 
This performance is inspired by the beauty of Vietnam's national flower, a symbol of purity, simplicity, and elegance, expressed through traditional and contemporary dance language, bringing unforgettable emotions to the audience with sweet melodies and the graceful movements of dancers resembling fragrant lotus flowers. 

6. Performance: Vietnamese Schoolgirl Áo Dài 
The "White Áo Dài of schoolgirls" is a famous uniform of Đồng Khánh female students in the capital region – the last imperial city of Vietnam. The graceful, delicate, and elegant schoolgirls in pure white Áo Dài have been immortalized in sweet and tender verses: “How lovely are the two wonderful pieces, The back and front form the words of the nation.” 

7. Performance: Áo Dài Show 
Áo Dài… the traditional attire of the Vietnamese people. 
Áo Dài… carrying culture through the ages. 
Áo Dài is a cultural bridge connecting generations. 
Áo Dài Show… a place to honor Vietnamese traditional culture. 
(Showcasing collections of Áo Dài from famous Vietnamese designers) 

***** 
At the end of the program, guests will have the opportunity to take photos capturing beautiful cultural moments with the performers and models.

loc_106.name: Dong Dinh Museum
loc_106.description: Dong Dinh Museum is one of the three private museums nationwide that has been licensed to operate and is located in the Son Tra National Forbidden Forest, displaying ancient ceramic artifacts dating from 100 to 2,500 years old. Address: Near Linh Ung Pagoda, Tho Quang Ward, Son Tra District, Da Nang City. Opening hours: 08:00 AM – 05:00 PM. Overview: The ancient ceramic artifacts have been authenticated and belong to the cultures of Dai Viet, Sa Huynh, Champa, Chinese culture, and other regional cultures at Dong Dinh Museum. Exploration: The exhibition includes two traditional wooden houses: one is the traditional house of Mr. Le Tuat, who is considered the father of pottery in Quang Nam, and the other is the wooden house of Mr. Nguyen Nhan, which simulates a wooden house built in the 1930s. There is also a modern architectural house that utilizes the ecological space of the forest, built on a gentle hill. The most common feature that Dong Dinh Museum offers visitors is a cultural and artistic space harmoniously combined with an ecological environment, providing visitors with a sense of both enrichment and relaxation after busy days in everyday life. loc_107.name: F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar
loc_107.description: Located on the 29th floor of the gold-plated Wyndham Danang Golden Bay hotel, the F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar restaurant naturally becomes the highest European cuisine restaurant in Da Nang. With its luxurious design and romantic atmosphere, F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar is the ideal place for those who wish to experience a fine dining feast at a unique height with family, business partners, or for a romantic date. EXPERIENCE HIGH-END EUROPEAN CUISINE AT THE F29 GOLDEN BEEF & SKY BAR WITH A UNIQUE VIEW FROM ABOVE From the height of the 29th floor, F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar is surrounded by transparent glass, welcoming natural light and providing an open space with a stunning 360-degree view. From here, you can admire the beautiful city of Da Nang, the lush Son Tra mountain, the poetic My Khe beach, or the moment when the whole city transforms with shimmering lights at night. The highest European restaurant in Da Nang – F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar Located on the top floor of the Wyndham Danang Golden Bay hotel, the restaurant proudly offers diners a sophisticated and unique European dining experience in a fine dining style, promising to satisfy even the most discerning food lovers. The panoramic view of Da Nang from F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar LUXURIOUS AND CHARMING SPACE At F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar, the space is designed with a dominant black tone, accented by the green and red of high-end furnishings, providing diners with a sense of luxury and class from every angle. Additionally, the restaurant features two private spaces with a capacity of 10-20 guests, making it an ideal stop for important occasions with loved ones or partners. The specially luxurious design of the restaurant The luxurious Lounge area Not only offering high-end dining experiences in the restaurant area, the elegantly designed indoor bar or the spacious outdoor sky bar of F29 Golden Beef will be a perfect spot to enjoy the sunset from above and savor specially crafted drinks. The bar of the restaurant EXPERIENCE TOP-NOTCH EUROPEAN CUISINE The main kitchen of F29 Golden Beef & Sky Bar is designed in an open space, allowing diners to observe the cooking process firsthand. In the restaurant's kitchen, dishes are prepared with the freshest ingredients, by the passionate hands of the chef, with meticulous preparation and thoughtful presentation bringing distinctive culinary flavors. The luxurious space along with the completely open kitchen offers a unique experience With a diverse and rich menu focusing on steak and seafood, diners can completely choose their own story with the ala carte menu or the golden set menu designed for a day to indulge in the chef's arrangements. Notably, the restaurant's famous gold-plated beef delights food enthusiasts. The combination of premium beef flavor and the shimmering gold coating creates a luxurious blend, turning the dish into a work of art. Accompanied by an impressive drink menu with a variety of interesting creative cocktails, it promises you a perfect evening. The famous gold-plated beef at the restaurant The restaurant truly is a culinary destination for discerning diners, an "oasis" amidst the clouds with breathtaking views led by top chefs, premium service, and exquisite quality. loc_108.name: Nami Beach Club
loc_108.description: Just 10 minutes from the center of Da Nang, Nami Beach Club is a beautiful entertainment space within the Japanese-style resort complex – Da Nang Mikazuki Japanese Resorts & Spa. NAMI BEACH CLUB: A TOP DESTINATION TO ENJOY LUXURY BY THE BEACH Featuring a luxurious outdoor pool, a restaurant, along with banquet halls and conference rooms next to Da Nang Bay, this is the ideal destination to indulge in luxury and relaxation by the sea. REDEFINING EXPERIENCE AND LIFESTYLE In a massive pool with cabanas, sun loungers, sofas, and seating next to the bar, what could be better than enjoying exquisite cocktails, delicious dishes, and immersing yourself in a vibrant musical atmosphere? Furthermore, don’t forget to savor the pizzas made fresh on-site and baked in a unique wood-fired oven, ensuring a fresh and authentic flavor that will meet the expectations of even the most discerning guests. NAMI RESTAURANT: THE MOVEMENT OF EASTERN CUISINE Inspired by “waves” (Nami in Japanese means “waves”), the rhythm of the sea, and the soothing sounds that make diners feel more relaxed while dining, Nami Restaurant delights your palate with traditional Vietnamese dishes, artfully blending the influences of Japanese, Korean, and Chinese cuisines. IDEAL CHOICE FOR OUTDOOR EVENTS AND WEDDINGS The sea has always been a source of inspiration for romance, elegance, and poetry. loc_110.description: EXPERIENCE THE CHARM OF LATIN SPIRIT AT CIELA SKYBAR AND DINING AT VOCO MA BELLE DANANG, AN IHG HOTEL voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel, a new lifestyle hotel, has launched the Ciela Skybar and Dining restaurant and bar on the rooftop, serving the first authentic South American cuisine in Da Nang. Ciela Skybar and Dining is located on the highest floor of the hotel, offering panoramic views of My Khe beach, Da Nang. September 2024 (Da Nang, Vietnam): With a commitment to enhancing the customer experience, voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel, has launched Ciela Skybar and Dining, the first bar serving South American cuisine in Da Nang, which promises to be a must-visit destination for food enthusiasts. Situated on the 26th floor of the hotel, with sweeping views of the long coastline and vibrant city, this is an attractive destination that brings the lively spirit of South America to Da Nang. In Spanish, Ciela means "sky" or "paradise," reflecting the vast and enchanting beauty of the sky and nature. As a dual-purpose venue, during the day, Ciela Skybar and Dining is a stylish poolside bar serving enticing drinks and a variety of light snacks such as salads, fresh sandwiches, tacos, gourmet pizzas, and hamburgers. Here, guests can enjoy simple lunches or light snacks while relaxing in the infinity pool. As the sun sets, Ciela transforms from a bar into a trendy South American restaurant serving guests a luxurious dinner. This is where visitors can gaze at the picturesque My Khe beach and the sparkling city lights while sipping on creatively crafted cocktails. Inspired by the "voco style," the combination of premium spirits and unique ingredients has created enticing cocktails such as: Above the Clouds (Bacardi white rum, pineapple ginseng tea, matcha, and egg white) and Tito Blossom (Roku gin, yuzu jam, and perilla). Happening daily from 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM, the golden hour Happy Hour offers guests attractive "buy one get one free" deals on select beers, wines, cocktails, and mocktails – a highlight that visitors should not miss. From 7:30 PM to 10:30 PM, the Ciela space becomes even more vibrant with live performances from famous DJs. Guests can experience a unique culinary journey, including creative cocktails and cuisine inspired by South America. A meeting point for stylish guests, Ciela offers unique South American flavors inspired by the fusion of Latin American cultures, a region renowned for its rich cuisine and long-standing cultural traditions. Additionally, Nikkei cuisine – an intriguing blend of Japanese and Peruvian dishes – is one of the impressive styles that captivate diners. Signature dishes at Ciela include: Mr Lima (ceviche, leche de tigre, chili, sweet potato, and corn) and Octopus (smoked grilled octopus, potato fondant, chorizo sausage, romesco sauce, and red chimichurri sauce). Not just a restaurant and bar with a modern Latin flair, Ciela Skybar and Dining also features a private dining area on the 27th floor, making it an ideal venue for events and meetings. The hotel's professional staff can arrange flexible spaces to suit various event sizes, from special dinners and youthful cocktail parties to lively gatherings. The stunning scenery here is sure to please every guest. "Ciela is not just a dining restaurant; it is also an experiential space that embodies a lively, optimistic, and inspiring spirit. Here, we create a vibrant and friendly atmosphere where guests can celebrate special occasions and create unforgettable memories. From light meals served during the day to sunset drinks with unique Latin-inspired themes, along with breathtaking views, all contribute to an exciting 'voco style'," said Mr. Daniel Solombrino, General Manager of voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel. voco Ma Belle Danang, an IHG Hotel – the first voco brand hotel of IHG Hotels & Resorts in Vietnam, is a resort destination where free-spirited travelers can feel the endless energy of Vietnam's Central Coast. loc_113.name: Tuy Loan Village Communal House
loc_113.description: The Túy Loan Village Communal House is a structure over 500 years old, the most impressive and historically significant site in Da Nang city. It is a place of spiritual worship, holding immense historical value in terms of architecture, with valuable historical artifacts, and it preserves 25 royal decrees granted by the Nguyễn dynasty. In addition to its unique architectural features, the communal house has a stele dating back to the first year of Thành Thái (1889) and many horizontal and vertical panels that are over 100 years old. Not only does the Túy Loan Village Communal House showcase distinctive architecture, but it also marks significant events in the golden history of resistance against foreign invaders. In 1945, the people of Túy Loan used the communal house and church as headquarters to oppose the colonial regime, joining forces with An Phước to seize power from the French and Japanese. The communal house also served as a base for our troops and people during the years of resistance against foreign invaders. The Túy Loan Village Festival takes place over two days, on the 9th and 10th of the first lunar month, featuring both ritual and festive activities. The festival includes traditional activities such as the procession of royal decrees, worship ceremonies, bài chòi singing, folk games, boat racing, and singing contests on the river, as well as performances of Phước Lộc Thọ; showcasing traditional products like Túy Loan rice paper, various local cakes, and safe vegetables from Túy Loan; and competitions related to traditional crafts such as rice paper making, rice paper grilling, and bánh tét wrapping. An equally captivating aspect that attracts a large audience is the human chess (living chess)…. DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_115.name: Bana Rita Farm
loc_115.description: After a long day at work, if you want to explore the wild nature and chill & cheer "to the max" with your family or friends in Da Nang, then head straight to BANA RITA GLAMPING FARM. Just 17km (28 minutes by motorbike or car) from Da Nang Airport, you will reach Hoang Van Thai Street leading up to Ba Na - Suoi Mo, a beautiful route located in the Northwest of Da Nang City. BANA RITA FARM is a completely new camping experience at the foot of Ba Na Mountain, a very special area where the rooster's crow awakens the dawn for the three communes of Hoa Phu, Hoa Ninh, and Hoa Nhon in Hoa Vang District, Da Nang City. You can cast your net and fish in the Cao Son Stream that embraces the 5-hectare farm garden. You can pick tea leaves from the farm, gather firewood to boil water, and brew a cup of green tea to welcome the dawn peeking behind Hon Nang Mountain, admiring the dew drops resting on the green grass. Immerse yourself in the cool breeze of the mountains, watching Hon Nang glow in the darkness, you will feel like you are lost in a magical space very different from the city. The elegant and pure Nàng RITA, like a gem, is located on the Ba Na Suoi Mo tourist route, surrounded by the Cao Son Stream and sheltered by Hon Nang Mountain. This beautiful land at the foot of Ba Na Mountain is called BANA RITA. Go. Go to recharge and fill yourself with positive energy, ready for the busy days ahead in the city! loc_116.name: Mân Quang Temple
loc_116.description: Mân Quang Communal House is currently located in Mân Quang II neighborhood, Hòa Quý ward, Ngũ Hành Sơn district, Da Nang city. 1. Name: Mân Quang Communal House. 2. Location and directions: Mân Quang Communal House is currently located in Mân Quang II neighborhood, Hòa Quý ward, Ngũ Hành Sơn district, Da Nang city. It is about 6km southwest of the Ngũ Hành Sơn scenic area. 3. Type of monument: Mân Quang Communal House is a historical monument. 4. Description of the monument: Mân Quang Communal House was destroyed by invaders in 1972. The villagers of Mân Quang worked together to rebuild a new communal house to worship the deity and the ancestors, as well as those who contributed to the homeland and country. The house was inaugurated on December 21, 2003, using modern materials and reinforced concrete structure, but in the old style. The house measures 12.34m in length and 8.15m in width on a site of 696m. It is built facing northwest, consisting of a main hall with 3 compartments and 2 wings, and a rear altar. In front of the house are two large stone pillars, each topped with a lion statue. On either side are smaller pillars, each featuring a wine gourd. Next is a screen wall 2m high and 2.5m wide. The front of the screen wall is adorned with two cranes standing on a turtle. The inner side features a dragon horse, all made from ceramic pieces. On either side of the communal house are two small shrines, the right shrine worships a general from the Nguyễn clan, and the left shrine worships a general from the Võ clan. According to legend, these are the two generals who defeated the sea monster that troubled the lives of the local residents. The steps leading up to the front hall have two round columns decorated with two coiling dragons. The two columns at the ends of the eaves are square and have couplets inscribed on them. Previously, the old communal house had four green stone columns inscribed with four couplets. Currently, the house still retains two eaves columns made of green stone. Inside the house, the rear altar worships the village's tutelary god. The left and right sides are dedicated to the ancestors. The roof of the communal house is tiled, and the rear altar has its own roof. The ridge is decorated with the motif of "two dragons worshiping the sun." The ends of the roof are adorned with two phoenixes. In the center above the eaves is inscribed "Mân Quang Communal House." On either side are two turtles. All these decorative items are made from ceramic pieces. The eaves are fitted with a row of small blue-glazed plates. At both ends of the steps are two large lion statues. The courtyard of the communal house has been paved with cement. A fence has also been built around the house. The house is situated in the middle of a field, making it very airy on all four sides. 6. Artifacts in the monument: The communal house has been burned and plowed multiple times, so the worship items and royal decrees have been lost. Currently, the house retains 3 royal decrees from the Đinh, Lê, and Trần clans dating back to the second year of Khải Định (1917). 7. Forms of cultural activities, folk traditions, and festivals: Every year, the villagers hold a prayer ceremony for peace on the 10th day of the 3rd lunar month. All offerings for the ceremonies are contributed by the villagers. 8. Historical, scientific, artistic, and cultural value: Although the communal house was destroyed during the war and many artifacts were lost, the clans still retain 3 royal decrees for the ancestors. Additionally, the clans have preserved a funeral poem. A special feature of Mân Quang Communal House is that it includes the name of the Hero of the People's Armed Forces Trần Minh Thiệt, who was a major general and deputy chief of staff of Military Region V, in the funeral poem. This reflects the villagers' deep gratitude and remembrance for those who contributed to the homeland, regardless of the era they lived in. The newly built communal house also has an inscription about the journey of the ancestors to this land, which has been translated into Vietnamese. The reconstruction of the new communal house in 2003 also demonstrates profound gratitude towards the predecessors, despite the economic difficulties faced by the villagers of Mân Quang. This is also a beautiful tradition that all residents of the village are obliged to continue and pass on to future generations. DA NANG MUSEUM OF CULTURAL HERITAGE MANAGEMENT BOARD

loc_117.name: Me Village
loc_117.description: Mê Village is located about 20 km from the center of Da Nang, in Nam Yen hamlet, Hoa Bac commune. With the advantage of a fresh environmental landscape, a peaceful view of Cu De River, and majestic mountains, Mê Village is an ideal destination for visitors seeking relaxation, picnics, and outdoor activities with family, friends, companies, or organizations. Visitors to Mê Village can truly immerse themselves in the cool green space of nature and the fresh atmosphere. Mê Village is separated from residential areas, so it is quiet, free from traffic noise and pollution. Guests can completely relax at Mê Village any day of the week. Enjoying the green, tranquil, and serene environment is a hallmark of Mê Village. The tents accommodate 4-5 people, with two layers to protect against rain, wind, and insects. They are fully equipped with clean blankets and pillows to ensure the most comfortable experience for guests. In front of the tents, there is a large area of land with green grass for organizing parties, birthdays, and gatherings. At night, everyone staying at the village can gather around the campfire. At Mê Village, the restaurant and café always offer signature drinks from Hoa Bac such as sugarcane juice, guava juice, and watermelon, and there are outdoor BBQ parties at night. Mê Village collaborates with local families and farmers, providing visitors the opportunity for real-life experiences. Guests can participate in interesting activities such as visiting sugarcane, beans, and watermelons. Moreover, after participating, visitors can purchase unique gifts such as sugarcane, sugarcane juice, clean vegetables, local fruits, sweet potatoes, corn, and free-range chicken of guaranteed quality directly from the gardens to give to loved ones or friends. Additionally, the village offers camping accommodation services, a children's swimming pool, a stage for organizing group activities, and meets the needs for dining, refreshments, and relaxation in a quiet space. It also provides agricultural products for guests to take home as gifts if desired. DA NANG TOURISM PROMOTION CENTER

loc_120.description:
Yên Retreat is an emerging eco-tourism destination in Da Nang, located about 35km from Da Nang city in Hoa Bac commune, Hoa Vang district. It takes about 40 minutes to get there by motorbike or car. The route is relatively simple and easy to navigate. 

INTRODUCING YÊN RETREAT 

How long has it been since you breathed in fresh air by a river or stream? How long has it been since you had the chance to sit together with friends, sharing stories amidst the cool nature? How long has it been since you took the time to reflect on life or simply sat by the tranquil river, watching the delicate wildflowers sway in the breeze, letting your soul wander with the mountains and rivers? If there comes a day when the urban hustle makes you feel suffocated, luxurious conveniences feel too ordinary, or city life wears you out… then perhaps you can take a little time to… return to Yên. 

SERVICES AT YÊN RETREAT 

Services at Yên Retreat include: coffee, dining and BBQ without overnight stay (400,000 VND), event organization, overnight camping (600,000 VND), and customized services (company tours, wedding photography, event organization, birthday parties, picnic programs…). Guests can contact Mr. Vũ directly at (0935 888 293) or email: yenretreat@gmail.com. 

According to https://yenretreat.com/

loc_121.name: Vung Bot
loc_121.description: Vung Bot is the source of the Cu De River, where the two branches of the North River and the South River converge, originating from the majestic Truong Son mountain range. At Vung Bot, visitors can fish, catch shrimp, and bathe in the stream. Tourists will be safer when accompanied by local people who are knowledgeable about the stream. Hoa Bac is located about 40 km northwest of the city center, and Hoa Bac commune belongs to Hoa Vang district, Da Nang, situated between the Bạch Mã National Park and Ba Na – Nui Chua Nature Reserve, formed by mountain ranges with an average height of about 200 meters above sea level. This area boasts diverse primary forests, beautiful rivers, streams, and waterfalls, almost untouched by natural wilderness. Based on its advantages in terrain, climate, and rich resources, several ecological and community tourism areas have been established here, providing opportunities for visitors to explore, learn about, and experience the local scenery and culture.

loc_122.name: Hòa Bắc Gươl House
loc_122.description:
In the area of Da Nang City, the Co Tu community primarily resides in the villages of Ta Lang, Gian Bi (Hoa Bac commune) and Phu Tuc (Hoa Phu commune). Among them, the two villages of Ta Lang and Gian Bi have more than 250 Co Tu households. The Gươl house in the two villages of Ta Lang and Gian Bi (Hoa Bac commune, Hoa Vang district) serves the needs of tourists to visit, enjoy various forms of traditional culture, and display the most important traditional Co Tu crafts during festivals and holidays. For the Co Tu people, the Gươl house is the communal house of the village, where it is not only a sacred living space but also considered the soul of the village. Here, one can clearly see the talents of folk artisans and the multi-dimensional cultural values of the Co Tu people. The Gươl is a place to worship the folk deities, ancestors, and forefathers of the Co Tu. The Gươl house preserves common treasures and wealth, serves as a meeting place, for rituals, performances of various art forms, and folk games. According to Elder Alăng Mỹ (64 years old, residing in Ta Lang village, Hoa Bac commune), the Co Tu people believe that the Gươl house is a sacred place where deities, ancestors, and forefathers reside. Inside the Gươl, people are not allowed to argue but must always unite, support, and love one another for the survival and development of their lineage. On the roof of the Gươl house, at both gable ends, there are statues of roosters, symbolizing the creature that awakens people each morning. The roof is thatched with palm leaves or nipa leaves. The Gươl house is built in the style of a stilt house, with one main pillar (father pillar) in the center and eight smaller pillars surrounding it, connected to form a sturdy system. The main pillar plays a very important role, symbolizing the backbone of the village elder. The more beautiful and taller the pillar, the more it represents the authority of the village elder and the strength of that village. Nowadays, the Co Tu have replaced wooden pillars with concrete pillars and painted them to look like wood. The Co Tu people believe that the tring bird is the messenger of the Rice God, guiding them to find new land for cultivation and establishing villages. Therefore, on the main pillar, there are carvings of a pair of tring birds and a rooster, representing beauty, the connection between humans and nature, and the desire for fertility and a happy life. The crossbeams are decorated with patterns, motifs, and images of daily life in the community such as: young men hunting, young women dancing tung tung da dá, gong performances, and rice pounding… which help embellish the interior of the house, showcasing the unique culture of the Co Tu people. Particularly, in the past, when the Co Tu went hunting in the forest, they would bring back animal skulls or buffalo skulls after the sacrifice ceremony to hang on the walls, pillars, and beams of the Gươl house. Inside the Gươl is a place to worship the deities according to the folk beliefs of the Co Tu, with hopes for favorable weather, bountiful harvests, and good fortune for the villagers. Also, right in the middle of the main pillar, the community carves the image of a mortar symmetrically on the top and bottom. This image symbolizes both abundance and fertility. Among them, the most important part is the mirror, which is attached symmetrically with two thin wooden panels carved with the image of a pair of tring birds and a rooster. This symbolizes the two arms of a Co Tu woman dancing the tung tung da dá, offering to the Rice God and the Sky God everything they have produced. The sculptures and the long-standing culture preserved in the community's house have made the Gươl house a familiar, close image and a source of pride for the Co Tu people. It helps future generations understand and inherit the material and spiritual cultural values of their ethnicity. 

THE MEANING OF THE “TUNG TUNG DA ZÁ” DANCE OF THE CO TU PEOPLE
The “Tung tung da zá” dance, also known as the (heavenly offering dance), has been closely linked to the spiritual life of the Co Tu for generations. No Co Tu person, whether in Quang Nam, Da Nang, or distant Thua Thien Hue, is unfamiliar with this dance. The movements in the Tung tung da zá dance mimic the daily labor and activities of the Co Tu people such as rice harvesting, fishing, hunting, and various festivals. The “Tung tung da zá” dance is often performed during community gatherings, at festivals, buffalo stabbing ceremonies, new rice celebrations, village establishment, Gươl house construction, and friendship ceremonies between villages, as a way for the Co Tu to connect with the universe, ancestors, and deities, expressing their reverence and gratitude towards those who cleared the land and established villages. “Tung tung” is the dance of men, symbolizing rising high, strength, stability, and valor, expressing the desire to conquer the universe and the wish for a better life. Meanwhile, “da zá” is the dance of women, symbolizing straightness and rhythm, embodying the spiritual aspiration of honoring the earth and sky, loyalty, and respect for hierarchy. In the vast space of the mountains and forests, along with the sounds of gongs and other traditional instruments, the “Tung tung da zá” dance serves as a prayer from the Co Tu to the deities and ancestors. loc_123.name: Alăng Như Homestay
loc_123.description: Officially operational since October 2019, Homestay Alăng Như is an initial highlight in the implementation of the project “Developing community tourism combined with preserving the culture of the Co Tu people in Tà Lang and Giàn Bí villages (Hòa Bắc commune),” contributing to the development of community tourism in Hòa Vang district. Through this, it introduces the culture of the Co Tu community in the two villages of Tà Lang and Giàn Bí to domestic and international tourists. Located about 35 km from the center of Da Nang city, Homestay Alăng Như is situated in Giàn Bí village (Hòa Bắc commune, Hòa Vang district) and is owned by Đinh Văn Như, a native of Giàn Bí village. The homestay is simply designed in the shape of a two-story stilt house; the first floor serves as a reception area, dining area, and common living space; the second floor features a large sleeping area with separate beds and curtains. The interior and exterior decoration uses locally available materials such as bamboo, wood, stone, and traditional items of the Co Tu people. Along with Homestay Alăng Như, a community tourism cooperative led by Như has been established. The cooperative has 7 main occupational groups operating right at the homestay, including: textile weaving, weaving, trekking, cuisine, gong performances, guiding, and cultural activities. Như stated: “All members of the cooperative are residents of the two villages of Tà Lang and Giàn Bí. Previously, they did not have stable jobs and only worked as hired laborers or in agriculture.” Eco-tourism exploration at the homestay should be scheduled 2-3 days in advance before the guests arrive to ensure thorough preparation. Guests can choose to experience a fixed tour itinerary or customize their experience according to their preferences. For the fixed tour, first, guests will be taken by the guiding group to visit the Co Tu village and learn about the history and culture of the local ethnic community. Next, guests will visit the traditional house of Giàn Bí village to experience textile weaving and then participate in weaving with artisans in the traditional house space of Tà Lang village. After a lunch break, guests will enjoy local specialties such as buffalo horn cakes, various wild vegetables, stream fish, and continue their experience with trekking and visiting other locations like Vũng Bọt stream and Khe Đương. In the evening, guests can join cultural activities, have a campfire with local residents, and enjoy a music party featuring traditional gong dances of the Co Tu people, creating an impressive night on the lush grass behind the homestay. Như mentioned: “In the near future, I plan to build a bathing area behind the homestay, along with constructing some huts in the grassy area of the homestay and planting fruit trees for guests to experience.”

loc_124.name: Hội Yên Parish Church
loc_124.description: Hội Yên Parish Church belongs to the Hòa Vang Diocese – Đà Nẵng Diocese, with 130 households and 525 parishioners among a community of over 5,000 people in Hòa Bắc Commune, Hòa Vang District (Statistics from 2023). With its location considered advantageous, where "the mountain leans against the water," Hội Yên Parish Church embodies both the majestic strength of high mountains and the gentle serenity of the river. The church was built in the 1990s under challenging conditions. In 2018, the church was rebuilt with an attractive and harmonious architectural style. The design features high, wide arches that create a spacious atmosphere for the sanctuary. The choice of stone cladding for the church's exterior has created a unique feature with the prominent red tiled roof. True to its name, Hội Yên gathers all that is most peaceful in a rural area. Strolling around the church, one can feel the tranquility of the place with its grounds adorned with sacred statues. Parishioners pray together, children play joyfully, the church bells resonate, and doves hurriedly flap their wings to fly… these are the strangely peaceful images one encounters when visiting Hội Yên Parish Church. It is this extraordinary beauty and profound tranquility that have attracted a large number of visitors. Image copyright belongs to: Da Nang Photography Club and Danang FantastiCity.

loc_125.name: Hoà Bắc suspension bridge
loc_125.description: The Hòa Bắc suspension bridge was started on January 15, 2001, and completed on September 2, 2002. The investor is the Department of Transport and Communications of Da Nang City. The Construction Corporation No. 5 supported the superstructure, the bridge was designed by Consulting Company 533, and the construction unit was Construction Enterprise 331. The bridge is 151.4 meters long, 7.5 meters wide, and has a load capacity of 8 tons. The total cost of building the bridge is approximately over 8 billion VND. The completion of the Hòa Bắc suspension bridge has fulfilled the dream of thousands of people living in Hòa Bắc commune along the banks of the Cu Đê River, connecting the center of the commune to the other side of the bridge, linking three hamlets: Lộc Mỹ, Nam Yên, and An Định. This is a beautiful sunset viewing spot from the west until the golden rays of the sun fade behind the mountain peaks. Hòa Bắc is about 40 km northwest of the city center, belonging to Hòa Vang district, Da Nang, situated between the Bạch Mã National Park and Bà Nà – Núi Chúa nature reserve, formed by mountain ranges with an average height of about 200 meters above sea level. This area boasts diverse primary forests, beautiful rivers, streams, and waterfalls, almost untouched by natural wilderness. Based on its advantages in terrain, climate, and rich resources, several ecological and community tourism areas have been established here, providing opportunities for visitors to explore, learn about, and experience the local scenery and culture.
